articles.title: U.S. Urged Not to Patronize Its Colonial Stooge's Racket for Confrontation with Fellow Countrymen
articles.content:
U.S. Urged Not to Patronize Its Colonial Stooge's Racket for Confrontation with Fellow Countrymen
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the Panmunjom Mission of the Korean People's Army released a statement on Sunday.
					 The statement said:
					
					 It is widely known that the Park Geun Hye group of traitors in south Korea facing the worst ruling crisis is floating the fiction about the "north's involvement" in the "drone case" in a foolish bid to divert the public bitter criticism of it to the DPRK.
					
					 The DPRK has followed how the U.S. is using the puppet forces' new "charade" for confrontation with fellow countrymen.
					
					 As expected, the U.S. lost no chance to echo the puppet forces' conspiratorial racket to meet its interests like a wolf pouncing upon its prey.
					
					 The U.S. chief executive talked about "provocation" and "threat" from the DPRK together with his stooge during his  recent surprise junket to Seoul and is now echoing his south Korean lackeys' trumpeting about the "north's involvement" in the "drone case." 
					
					 The U.S. has gone the lengths of letting riff-raffs of the "UN Command", the defunct bogus organization, go to the area along the Military Demarcation Line in Panmunjom to oft-repeat the contents of the puppet forces' "results of investigation into the drone case" and claim over loudspeaker that the north violated Paragraphs 16 and 17 of Article 2 of the Armistice Agreement,.
					
					 The U.S. behavior is just like birds of a feather flocking together.
					
					 It is now orchestrating the same farce as what it had staged after the Cheonan warship sinking case cooked up by the puppet forces four years ago.
					
					 When the whole story about the hideous "charade" faked up by the puppet forces was brought to light at that time, the U.S. was so shameless as to feign ignorance, doggedly blocking the dispatch to the scene of the inspection group of the DPRK National Defence Commission and probe into the truth about the case proposed by the DPRK.
					
					 No matter how precious any alliance with the puppet forces is and no matter how valuable "honeymoon" with the disgraceful political prostitute is, the U.S. should have said and behaved like a big country according to reason.
					
					 If Washington pays heed only to what its stooges trumpet, it is bound to be accused of being a senile grandfather trying to stop a child from crying.
					
					 We cannot but question the U.S. which is taking issue with the DPRK again according to the scenario worked out by it with the puppet forces.
					
					 The U.S. claims that it is attaching importance to the relevant articles and paragraphs of the AA calling for respecting the airspace of the other party and stopping all aerial provocations. But why is the U.S infiltrating strategic reconnaissance and other planes into the airspace of the DPRK so frequently and beclouding the blue sky above the inviolable Korean peninsula by flying aircraft for strategic nuclear strikes.
					
					 Does the U.S. have neither face nor qualification to talk about someone's "violation of the AA" though it is creating extreme tensions through ceaseless military build-up and war maneuvers for aggression while systematically destroying, breaching and violating the AA after occupying other country.
					
					 We are well aware that all the U.S. actions are aimed at securing "plausible pretexts" for justifying the huge armed buildup needed for laying a siege to Eurasia and its permanent presence in south Korea as its outpost.
					
					 We clarify once again, the story about the "north's involvement" in the "drone case" is nothing but  a "charade" against the DPRK from A to Z, a replica of the Cheonan warship sinking case co-orchestrated by the U.S. and the puppet forces.
					
					 The truth has already been brought to light and those who faked up the "charade" will be sternly judged by history and the people anytime.
					
					 The U.S. had better stop such foolish act of patronizing for no reason the racket for confrontation against fellow countrymen kicked off by the poor colonial servant and come to its senses.

articles.title: DPRK FM Spokesman Slams U.S. for Pulling up DPRK
articles.content:
DPRK FM Spokesman Slams U.S. for Pulling up DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry gave the following answer to a question put by KCNA on Monday accusing U.S. officials of pulling up the DPRK over its residents' criticism of Obama reported by its media:
					 The resentment expressed by individuals of the DPRK at Obama recently was a proper reaction to him who malignantly insulted and slandered the dignified DPRK during his junket to south Korea.
					
					 Obama termed the DPRK's inevitable steps for self-defence a "provocation" and "threats" and cried out for tougher "sanctions", "pressure" and "not ruling out the use of military force." Not content with this vitriol, he went the lengths of letting loose a spate of such invectives that the DPRK is a "country which makes its people go hungry and takes a lonely path", "isolated state", "abnormal state" and "reckless and irresponsible" government.
					
					 This is an unpardonable insult to the people of the DPRK who are leading a happy life under the benevolent socialist system and considering independence dearer than their life and their resentment at the U.S.  is running high.
					
					 The U.S. had better stop letting loose rhetoric about the resentment expressed by DPRK residents at Obama and look back on his unspeakable invectives which enraged them so much.
					
					 The U.S. is trying to cover up the thrice-cursed wrongs committed by Obama and divert elsewhere criticism of him while finding fault with the bitter accusations of Koreans against him, but such a move would get it nowhere.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets SWAPO Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets SWAPO Delegation
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, met and had a talk with the delegation of the South West Africa People's Organization (SWAPO) of Namibia headed by Secretary General Nangolo Mbumba, who paid a courtesy call on him, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Monday.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Swiss Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Swiss Ambassador
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from Jean-Jacques de Dardel, Swiss ambassador to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Monday.
					 Kim had a conversation with the ambassador.

articles.title: Ri Su Yong Meets Russian Ambassador
articles.content:
Ri Su Yong Meets Russian Ambassador
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong met and had a talk with Alexandr Timonin, Russian ambassador to the DPRK who paid a courtesy call on him on Monday.

articles.title: Spring International Trade Fair Opens in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Spring International Trade Fair Opens in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- The 17th Pyongyang Spring International Trade Fair was opened with due ceremony at the Three-Revolution Exhibition House in the DPRK Monday.
					 The ceremony was attended by Kim Yong Jin, vice-premier of the Cabinet, Ri Ryong Nam, minister of Foreign Trade, Kim Song Dok, vice-chairman of the Pyongyang City People's Committee, Ri Hak Gwon, head of the DPRK Chamber of Commerce, officials in the field of trade, delegations from various countries and regions and diplomatic envoys and staff members of foreign embassies here.
					
					 Pak Ung Sik, director general of the Korean International Exhibition Corporation, made an opening address which was followed by a congratulatory speech by O Ryong Chol, vice-minister of Foreign Trade.
					
					 The speakers extended salute to the members of the delegations from various countries and regions which came to the fair with common desire to achieve independence, peace, development and prosperity.
					
					 They referred to the fact that thanks to the positive activities of the participants the fair is developing to be an international assembly of business persons conducive to boosting the economic and trade relations and promoting economic progress among various countries and regions of the world.
					
					 At the end of the ceremony the participants looked round products on display presented by companies of the DPRK, China, New Zealand, Germany, Malaysia, Mongolia, Switzerland, Singapore, Australia, Indonesia, Vietnam, Italy, Thailand, Cuba, Poland and Taipei of China.
					
					 The fair will last till May 15.

articles.title: 14th May 21 Architectural Festival Opens
articles.content:
14th May 21 Architectural Festival Opens
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- The 14th May 21 Architectural Festival was opened with due ceremony at the Central Youth Hall Monday.
					 On display at the festival were at least 600 architectural designs for prize contest and scientific papers, at least 30 computer programs and multimedia presented by architects and technicians in the field of the construction, officials and students in the field of scientific and educational institutions from across the country.
					
					 Present at the ceremony were Tong Jong Ho, minister of Construction and Building-Materials Industry, Kang Yong Su, minister of Urban Management, Kim Kyong Jun, minister of Land and Environment Protection, officials concerned, officials in the fields of designing, construction, building materials and supervision, officials of fine arts studios and scientific research and educational institutions, architects, technicians, teachers, researchers and creators.
					
					 Sim Yong Hak, vice-chairman of the C.C., the Architects Union of Korea, made an opening ceremony.
					
					 At the end of the ceremony, they looked round the venue of the festival.

articles.title: 9th Symposium on Architectural Aesthetics Held
articles.content:
9th Symposium on Architectural Aesthetics Held
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- The 9th Symposium on Architectural Aesthetics took place at the Central Youth Hall on Monday.
					 Present there were O Su Yong, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Yong Jin, vice-premier of the Cabinet, officials concerned, officials in the fields of designing, construction, building materials and supervision, officials of fine arts studios and scientific research and educational institutions, architects, technicians, teachers, researchers and creators.
					
					 Speeches were made by Yang Ki Song, vice-minister of State Construction Control, So Jong Gil, vice-director general of the General Bureau of Pleasure Park, Kim Song Min, deputy director of the Mansudae Art Studio, Ham Tong Hyok, section chief of the Paektusan Architectural Institute and Kim Chang Sik, chief of the City Designing Institute of North Phyongan Province.
					
					 They said that President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il performed immortal exploits in the field of construction.
					
					 They proved the validity and vitality of the idea and theory of Juche-based architecture and the policy of construction indicated by supreme leader Kim Jong Un and referred to issues arising in building monumental edifices.
					
					 They said that Kim Jong Un who newly formulated the essence of the Juche-based socialist architecture as the people-first architecture made sure that more constructions conducive to the cultural and emotional life of the people were built to make the country replete with joyful and happy laughs of the people.
					
					 The speakers stressed the need to defend and glorify the immortal exploits of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and open up a new period of prosperity in the construction true to the far-reaching plan of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Delegation of China Disabled Persons' Federation Here
articles.content:
Delegation of China Disabled Persons' Federation Here
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the China Disabled Persons' Federation led by Vice President Cheng Kai arrived here on Monday.

articles.title: Chinese Visit Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Chinese Visit Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il 
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the China Disabled Persons' Federation led by Vice President Cheng Kai visited statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Monday. 
					 They laid bouquets before the statues and bowed to them.

articles.title: NPCK Delegation Returns from China
articles.content:
NPCK Delegation Returns from China
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the National Peace Committee of Korea (NPCK) led by Vice-Chairman Kim Jin Bom came back home Monday after visiting China.

articles.title: DPRK Judoists Prove Successful in 7th East-Asian Judo Championships
articles.content:
DPRK Judoists Prove Successful in 7th East-Asian Judo Championships
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- Judoists of the DPRK proved successful in the 7th East-Asian Judo Championships held in Mongolia.  
					 Jon Yu Sun beat her rivals from Taipei of China and Mongolia in the 48 kg category event and advanced into a final match. In the match she trounced her Japanese rival with an overwhelming technical edge.
					
					 In the meantime, Kim Su Gyong came second in the women's 63kg category and Kim Chung Hyok, Choe Yong Sik and Pak Hong Wi placed third in the men's 60kg, 66kg and 81kg categories and Rim Song Sim and Kim Song Hwa finished third in the women's 52kg and 70kg categories respectively. 
					
					 DPRK judoists took the third place in the women's team event of the championships.

articles.title: DPRK Wrestler Catches Gold Medal at 2014 Asian Junior Wrestling Championship
articles.content:
DPRK Wrestler Catches Gold Medal at 2014 Asian Junior Wrestling Championship
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- DPRK wrestler Ri Kum Chol bagged a gold medal at 42kg category of freestyle wrestling of the 2014 Asian Junior Wrestling Championship held in Thailand. 
					 He defeated his Sri Lankan rival 12:1, Kyrgyz rival 8:3 and Indian rival 13:2 before advancing into the final match. 
					
					 He trounced his Iranian rival 10:0 to take the first place.

articles.title: High-yielding Fruit Tree Planting Brisk in DPRK
articles.content:
High-yielding Fruit Tree Planting Brisk in DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- A campaign for planting high-yielding fruit trees in spring was launched in the DPRK.
					 According to data available, dwarf apple, pear, plum, peach, apricot and other fruit trees have been planted in several thousand hectares of areas throughout the country.
					
					 The Kosan Fruit Farm created a new orchard of several hundred hectares through the campaign.
					
					 Fruit farms in Pukchong County planted hundreds of thousands of apple, pear and peach trees, with provision of 100 tons of quality compost, while those in Pyongyang and Kusong cities and Hwangju, Jangyon and Samchon counties respectively created tens of hectares of orchards.
					
					 In another development, co-op farms across the country have stepped up the works to replace the existing fruit trees with high-yielding ones and properly combine early-ripening fruit species with long-season ones.
					
					 Such works were carried out in 500-odd hectares of orchards in North Hwanghae Province and in several hundred hectares in North Phyongan Province.

articles.title: Production of Custom-built Equipment Increases in DPRK
articles.content:
Production of Custom-built Equipment Increases in DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- The Taean Heavy Machine Complex in the DPRK has made a signal progress in production of equipment needed to build power stations in tiers on the Chongchon River.
					 According to Ryang Mun Sang, vice chief-engineer of the complex, the production of scores of sets of generating equipment goes at the finishing stage through the recent one month of concentrated efforts.
					
					 In those days, the material combined workshop of the complex totally finished the manufacturing of various steel castings, including turbine blades.
					
					 The speed regulator workshop carried out its production assignment 100 percent and the casting shop under the material combined workshop its plan 70 percent.
					
					 Meanwhile, processing shops of the complex have over-fulfilled their plans through introduction of advanced methods effective in ensuring the processing speed and accuracy.

articles.title: DPRK Pays Big Efforts to Protection of Migratory Birds
articles.content:
DPRK Pays Big Efforts to Protection of Migratory Birds
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- May 11 and 12 are World's Day of Migratory Birds.
					 On this occasion, the DPRK has conducted intensive information activities through media, calling upon its citizens to pay attention to the protection of migratory birds.
					
					 Korea serves as a major passage route or stoppage place for migratory birds in Northeast Asia. Recently, 100-odd species of migratory birds have been observed in the country's northeastern part of Rason, drawing the attention of global ornithologists.
					
					 In the country many migratory birds stay to lay eggs, among them Platalea minor (black-faced spoonbill), Grus japonensis (red-crowned crane), Egretta eulophotes (Swinhoe's Egret) (Chinese Egret) and Grus vipio (white-naped crane).
					
					 Under the government measure, a drive to protect the birds has been made in tidelands along the east and west coasts of the country, mouth of rivers, swampy lands and island areas. Efforts were made to provide good habitats in passage routes for the birds.
					
					 More than 180 species of migratory birds live at or pass through the Mundok Migratory Bird Reserve and their number amounts to tens of thousands. Scores of species of them are subobsolete or rare-to-be-seen.
					
					 To protect such species, the government has strengthened international exchange and cooperation.
					
					 The government also dispatched ornithologists to the Sindo Migratory Bird Reserve and other sanctuaries to take necessary steps in keeping with breeding season of migratory birds.

articles.title: Park Geun Hye Censured for Her Treachery
articles.content:
Park Geun Hye Censured for Her Treachery
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- Park Geun Hye, the chief executive of south Korea, has been criticized at home and abroad as an old harlot serving foreigners because she left its "sovereign rights" to the mercy of the United States.
					 In this regard, Dr. Kang Chol, a teacher of Kim Il Sung University in the DPRK and a news expert, told KCNA:
					
					 Criticism against Park is growing stronger among the world media for having invited Obama to south Korea and asked him to extend the period of transfer of the wartime operation control (OPECON).
					
					 Shortly ago, Voice of Russia noted that a number of experts on world affairs ascribed the U.S.-south Korea re-extension of transfer of OPECON to other reason.
					
					 They commented: Tough counteraction against Pyongyang is no more than a political gesture because south Korea's armaments is 25 times higher than the DPRK's. Transfer of the right to military command to other country is a strike to a sovereign state's authority, but the south Korean "government" wants the U.S. forces to stay in south Korea and maintain the control over its army. The U.S. has seized control over all the military strength of south Korea and Japan. It concentrates its efforts on securing the control over military muscles of its Asia-Pacific military allies as a lever to deter China's any action over Diaoyu islands and other issues, not the DPRK.
					
					 This is a serious comment critical of Park, keen on offering "sovereignty" of south Korea as a sacrifice for foreign forces' world domination in a bid to stay in power.
					
					 When the seas of south Korea turned into a theatre of war gambles for the foreign aggressors and into a graveyard of many children, the Park Geun Hye group engaged itself in such treachery.
					
					 Park and her group of pro-American conservatives and war servants in south Korea should be buried into sea in time as they are a blot on the nation and hell-bent only on confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the north.

articles.title: Man-centered Literary and Art Theory Established in DPRK
articles.content:
Man-centered Literary and Art Theory Established in DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- In his lifetime leader Kim Jong Il had worked heart and soul to provide the Juche-based theory on literature and arts.
					 The history of human culture witnessed various forms of bourgeois and progressive literary and art thoughts, including naturalism, formalism, realism, classism, romanticism, critical realism and socialist realism.
					
					 But, all of them could hardly meet the demand of the new era of Juche that calls for arts conducive to training the popular masses, the maker of history, into independent and creative beings.
					
					 Kim Jong Il kindled the flames of the literary and art revolution, regarding that to create the genuine humanics giving exposition of such problems of independence and an independent human being conforms to the requirement of the developing times.
					
					 He raised the banner of Juche-based realism, a fresh and revolutionary creative method national in style and socialist in content. And he developed Korean-style socialist realism, established by President Kim Il Sung during the anti-Japanese armed struggle, into Juche-based realism.
					
					 Juche realism based on the Juche idea, a perfect, realistic creative method and a man-centered theory on literature and arts, ushered in a new era of genuine humanics, a period of socialist renaissance.
					
					 This theory now serves as the motive power in bringing a radical turn in the creation of arts in the DPRK under the guidance of Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: KCNA Blasts U.S. Dangerous Moves for Hegemony
articles.content:
KCNA Blasts U.S. Dangerous Moves for Hegemony
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- The U.S. is pursuing moves to steadily tighten the "triangular security cooperation" while planning to open a tripartite meeting of the defense chiefs of the U.S., Japan and south Korea.
					 Some days ago, a high-ranking official of the U.S. Defense Department asserted that "they could confirm whether the tripartite relations are placed on orbit" and he expected that "the tripartite cooperation would make bigger progress" through the meeting.
					
					 This reveals the U.S. sinister strategic intention to round off the establishment of the triangular military alliance under the pretext of the "threat" from someone and knock the "NATO of Asian version" into shape on its basis in order to contain the powers in the region and prevent its position as the "only super power in the world" from declining.
					
					 The U.S. has cried out for boosting the "triangular security cooperation" while talking about the "threat of the DPRK" before its stooges whenever an opportunity presented itself.
					
					 There is no "threat" from the DPRK in the Asia-Pacific region except for the U.S. nuclear threat, provocations and war moves against the former.
					
					 The "triangular security cooperation" is part of the U.S. moves to round off the triangular military alliance for aggression under the pretext of the "threat" from the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. has focused its efforts on establishing the above-said alliance with Japan and south Korea for a long time.
					
					 Now that the U.S. has its alliance with Japan and south Korea each, the former seeks to conclude an agreement whereby south Korea and Japan can form a military alliance for the purpose of knocking into shape a triangular military alliance. 
					
					 These days south Korea and Japan are busy discussing the issue of concluding an "agreement for protecting military intelligence," prompted by the U.S. scenario to round off the triangular military alliance by providing a legal guarantee for the military nexus between Japan and south Korea.
					
					 By putting this scenario into practice the U.S. seeks to complete the formation of the triangular military alliance and knock into shape the "NATO of Asian version" on its basis.
					
					 This is evidenced by the outbursts of U.S. high-ranking policy-makers and authorities that it is necessary to create "NATO of Asian version" with a view to holding a "leading position" in the Asia-Pacific region and to this end, it is imperative to boost military cooperation with its allies in the region and facilitate the formation of the alliance with them.
					
					 The U.S. position is rapidly declining due its excessive military spending and war moves. On the contrary, big powers in the Asia-Pacific region are making rapid progress in politics, economy and military.
					
					 Such development is not in line with the U.S. strategic purpose to maintain its position as "the world's only super power."
					
					 Feeling uneasy about it, the U.S. is working hard to knock into shape "NATO of Asian version" in order to militarily contain the potential rivals in the region and hold supremacy.
					
					 While stepping up its moves to form the triangular military alliance, pursuant to its strategy for dominating Asia-Pacific, Washington is working hard to develop the alliance into "NATO of Asian version" involving Australia and other countries in the future.
					
					 It is busy with diplomacy with those countries outside the triangular military alliance to bring them into "NATO of Asian version" and frantically stepping up the moves to tighten the U.S.-Japan-Australia and the U.S.-south Korea-Australia military alliances.
					
					 It is as clear as noonday that such moves of the U.S. for hegemony will spark off arms race, confrontation and military conflict in the Asia-Pacific region.
					
					 The international community is required to heighten vigilance against such scenario of the U.S.

articles.title: S. Korean Media Slams Authorities' Confrontation Row
articles.content:
S. Korean Media Slams Authorities' Confrontation Row
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Internet paper Voice of People on May 9 released an editorial denouncing the puppet authorities for kicking off a confrontation racket in the wake of ferry Sewol sinking accident.
					 The editorial said:
					
					 The approval rating for Park Geun Hye has rapidly sunk due to the regime's incompetence and irresponsibility disclosed in the course of handling the ferry sinking accident.
					
					 Park Geun Hye, Chongwadae and the ruling party are making a conspiratorial intrigue to tone down the people's anger as evidenced by their charade intended to pass the buck for the accident to the captain and crewmen of the ferry, much upset by it.
					
					 With the date of local election is drawing near, they are working hard to use the ferry sinking accident for the purpose of an "ideological argument about followers of the north."
					
					  The Park group, while raising a hue and cry over what it called emergency situation, openly declared "a war for achieving victory in the election" while conservative media are locked in "ideological argument," claiming that "photos on the memorial service for those who died in the ferry sinking accident posted on Internet homepage are meant to agitate the resignation of the regime" and "the disaster is abused as a lever for anti-government actions."
					
					 Park, in particular, issued an order at a "meeting of the State Council" to "severely punish those who spread false rumors and groundlessly hurled mud on the Internet homepage after finding them out," an indication of the ulterior motive of the conservative forces.
					
					 Her group's act of abusing the ferry sinking accident for "the ideological argument" is as foolish an act as digging its graves itself.

articles.title: Bird Flu Virus Detected from Migratory Birds in S. Korea
articles.content:
Bird Flu Virus Detected from Migratory Birds in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- Bird flu broke out on Jeju Island, according to the south Korean MBC on May 10.
					 H5N8 bird flu virus was reportedly detected from the excrement of migratory birds.

articles.title: S. Koreans Honor Memory of Victims of Ferry Sinking Tragedy
articles.content:
S. Koreans Honor Memory of Victims of Ferry Sinking Tragedy
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- A rally to honor the memory of victims of the ferry Sewol tragedy took place in Ansan, Kyonggi Province, south Korea on May 10, according to the south Korean CBS and KBS.
					 It was attended by more than 10 000 citizens and students in Ansan area.
					
					 The participants deplored that hundreds of people lost their lives due to the authorities' incompetence and irresponsibility.
					
					 They urged the "government" to opt for probing the truth behind the accident.
					
					 At least 2 000 students of 24 high schools in Ansan area held a candlelight rally on May 9 to cherish the memory of the students who died in the accident.
					
					 At least 200 students also staged a demonstration, demanding the punishment of those who caused the hideous disaster.
					
					 A memorial rally and candlelight demonstration also took place in Seoul to honor the victims.
					
					 The joint action to cope with the situation of five religious orders including Christian, Catholics and Buddhism in a prayer meeting and a rally held in Chonggye Plaza of Seoul on May 10 denounced the authorities for failing to take proper measures as regards the disaster.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Days to Be Observed in Ocean Region
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Days to Be Observed in Ocean Region
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- The Ocean regional remembrance committee was inaugurated on the occasions of the 20th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung and the 3rd anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Peter Woods, co-chairman of the Asia-Pacific Regional Committee for Supporting Peaceful Reunification of Korea, was elected advisor of the remembrance committee and Don Borrie, chairman of the New Zealand-DPRK Society, chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize colorful political and cultural events praising the exploits of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il on the occasions of the anniversaries of their demise (July 8 and December 17).

articles.title: Portavoz de Representacion del EPC en Phanmunjom denuncia el amparo de EE.UU. al Sur de Corea
articles.content:
Portavoz de Representacion del EPC en Phanmunjom denuncia el amparo de EE.UU. al Sur de Corea 
Pyongyang, 12 de mayo (ACNC) -- El portavoz de la Representacion del Ejercito Popular de Corea en Phanmunjom hizo publica el dia 11 una declaracion para condenar a Estados Unidos que se aprovecha del rumor que circulan ultimamente los titeres surcoreanos, segun el cual el "Norte de Corea" es el autor del llamado "incidente de drones".
					En estos dias, EE.UU. se hace complice de los titeres surcoreanos en la difusion del rumor de que el "incidente de drones" es "obra del Norte", comienza la nota y prosigue:
					
					Ademas, envio a la Linea de Demarcacion Militar en Phanmunjom a los fulanos y menganos de la "Comandancia de las Fuerzas de la ONU", aparato fantasmal, para que repitieran como papagayos el "resultado de investigacion del incidente de drones" publicado por los titeres surcoreanos y "protestaran" por altavoz la supuesta violacion de las clausulas 16 y 17 del segundo articulo del Acuerdo de Armisticio de Corea por parte de la RPDC.
					
					Tal accion ridicula de EE.UU. hace recordar este refran: El diablo los cria y ellos se juntan.
					
					EE.UU. reproduce ahora su comportamiento durante el caso de hundimiento de la corbeta "Cheonan", inventado por los titeres surcoreanos hace 4 anos.
					
					Al revelarse entonces que ese incidente fue un gran complot inventado por los titeres surcoreanos, EE.UU. impidio obstinadamente el envio al terreno de los hechos y la investigacion del grupo de inspeccion del Comite de Defensa Nacional, propuestos por la RPDC.
					
					Aunque le valgan mucho la llamada alianza con los titeres surcoreanos y la "luna de miel" con la prostituta politica, EE.UU. debera portarse y hablar logicamente acorde a su aspecto de potencia.
					
					Puesto que EE.UU. acusa nuevamente a la RPDC segun el guion del complot trazado de antemano con los titeres surcoreanos, nos vemos obligados a hacerle las siguientes preguntas:
					
					Por que EE.UU., que dice apreciar los articulos correspondientes del Acuerdo de Armisticio de respetar el espacio aereo jurisdiccional de la contraparte y no cometer ninguna provocacion aerea contra ella, incurre en las provocaciones de enviar a menudo los piratas aereos, inclusive el avion de reconocimiento estrategico, al aire jurisdiccional de la RPDC y de enturbiar el cielo azul de la Peninsula Coreana con los bombardeos de ejercicio de la flotilla de aviones de ataque nuclear estrategico?
					
					Tiene acaso EE.UU. un pedazo de decoro o calidad para hablar de la "violacion del Acuerdo de Armisticio" de alguien, puesto que ocupo el territorio de otro pais muy lejano, destruyo y violo sistematicamente el Acuerdo de Armisticio de Corea y agrava ahora la tension con el aumento de fuerzas armadas y los ejercicios de la guerra de agresion?
					
					Sabemos que todos los actos de EE.UU. se encaminan a preparar la "justificacion contundente" del aumento de las fuerzas armadas necesarias a la formacion del cerco del continente euroasiatico y de la ocupacion perenne del Sur de Corea que sirve de base avanzada para ello.
					
					EE.UU. debe volver en si dejandose de la tonteria de defender la campana de confrontacion fratricida de su sirviente colonial.

articles.title: MINREX rechaza nueva acusacion de EE.UU. contra la RPDC
articles.content:
MINREX rechaza nueva acusacion de EE.UU. contra la RPDC
Pyongyang, 12 de mayo (ACNC) -- Con respecto a que las figuras oficiales de Estados Unidos acusan a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea pretextando las opiniones de los habitantes divulgadas en las publicaciones coreanas, el portavoz del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la RPDC dio el dia 12 la siguiente respuesta a la ACNC: 
					Recientemente, algunos habitantes de nuestro pais expresaron su gran indignacion por Obama, ya que este ofendio y calumnio brutalmente a la digna RPDC durante su reciente visita al Sur de Corea. 
					
					Obama cuestiono las inevitables medidas de autodefensa de la RPDC como "provocacion" y "amenaza" insistiendo en la "sancion" y "presion" mas duras y en el "uso de fuerzas armadas". Para colmo, hablo mal de la digna RPDC describiendola como "pais que hace pasar hambre al pueblo y marcha por el camino aislado", "Estado abandonado y anormal" y "gobierno imprudente e irresponsable". 
					
					Esto es intolerable insulto al pueblo coreano que lleva una vida feliz en el grato regimen socialista y aprecia la independencia mas que la vida. Esta llegando al cielo la indignacion del pueblo coreano. 
					
					Antes de cuestionar las voces iracundas de los habitantes norcoreanos sobre Obama, EE.UU. debe recordar primero las palabras insolentes de su mandatario que fueron motivo directo de aquellas. 
					
					EE.UU. intenta esquivar la flecha encubriendo las maldades de Obama, que merecen castigo divino, y acusando las voces iracundas de los habitantes norcoreanos, pero no podra hacerlo nunca.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con delegacion de SWAPO de Namibia
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reune con delegacion de SWAPO de Namibia
Pyongyang, 12 de mayo (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, departio el dia 12 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con la delegacion de la Organizacion Popular de Africa Sudoccidental (SWAPO) de Namibia encabezada por su secretario general Nangolo Mbumba, que le realizo una visita de cortesia.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales de nuevo embajador suizo
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales de nuevo embajador suizo
Pyongyang, 12 de mayo (ACNC) -- Jean-Jacques de Dardel presento hoy en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae ante Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, sus cartas credenciales que le acreditan como nuevo embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de la Confederacion Suiza.
					Tras recibirlas, Kim departio con el diplomatico.

articles.title: Inaugurada 17a Exposicion Internacional de Mercancias Primaveral de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Inaugurada 17a Exposicion Internacional de Mercancias Primaveral de Pyongyang
Pyongyang, 12 de mayo (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 12 en la Exposicion Permanente de las Tres Revoluciones la ceremonia inaugural de la 17a Exposicion Internacional de Mercancias Primaveral de Pyongyang.
					Estuvieron presentes aqui el vicepremier Kim Yong Jin, el ministro de Comercio Exterior, Ri Ryong Nam, el vicepresidente del Comite Popular de la Ciudad de Pyongyang, Kim Song Tok, el presidente de la Camara de Comercio de la RPDC, Ri Hak Gwon, los funcionarios de la rama de comercio exterior, las delegaciones de varios paises y regiones y los representantes diplomaticos y los miembros de las embajadas de varios paises, acreditados en la RPDC.
					
					Tras las palabras de apertura del director de la Agencia de Exposiciones Internacionales de Corea, Pak Ung Sik, hubo el discurso de felicitacion pronunciado por el viceministro de Comercio Exterior, O Ryong Chol.
					
					Los oradores saludaron a los miembros de las delegaciones de varios paises y regiones que participaron en la feria con el deseo comun de lograr la independencia, la paz, el desarrollo y la prosperidad.
					
					Mencionaron que gracias a las actividades dinamicas de los participantes, esta exposicion se desarrolla, hoy en dia, como cita economica internacional que amplia las relaciones economicas y comerciales e impulsa el desarrollo economico entre varios paises y regiones del mundo.
					
					Al final de la ceremonia, los participantes pasaron revista a los articulos exhibidos por las companias de la RPDC, China, Nueva Zelanda, Alemania, Malasia, Mongolia, Suiza, Singapur, Australia, Indonesia, Vietnam, Italia, Tailandia, Cuba, Polonia y Taipei China.
					
					La feria se extendera hasta el dia 15.

articles.title: Inaugurado 14o Festival Arquitectonico 21 de Mayo
articles.content:
Inaugurado 14o Festival Arquitectonico 21 de Mayo
Pyongyang, 12 de mayo (ACNC) -- Quedo inaugurado en esta capital el XIV Festival Arquitectonico 21 de Mayo.
					En la ocasion fueron presentadas mas de 600 obras de disenos arquitectonicos y disertaciones cientificas y mas de 30 programas y multimedias hechos por los arquitectos y tecnicos de la rama del pais y los funcionarios de las instituciones cientificas y de educacion y los estudiantes.
					
					  La ceremonia inaugural se efectuo el dia 12 en la Casa Central de la Juventud.
					
					  En la ocasion estuvieron presentes el ministro de Construccion e Industria de Materiales de Construccion Tong Jong Ho, el ministro de Urbanismo Kang Yong Su, el ministro de Proteccion Territorial y Ambiental Kim Kyong Jun, y otros cuadros, los funcionarios de las ramas de diseno, construccion, materiales de construccion, control, creacion de bellas artes, e instituciones de investigacion cientifica y educacion, los arquitectos, tecnicos, profesores, investigadores y creadores.
					
					  Sim Yong Hak, vicepresidente del Comite Central de la Union de Arquitectos de Corea, hizo uso de la palabra inaugural.
					
					  Al terminado del acto, los participantes recorrieron la sede del festival.
